page.title: 15YALBERTON ESTATE
page.content: Development started in the area because jobs were needed.The council decided to buy land to build roads, sewers and sell plots to industrialist.The site is a good one because it is not close to any houses and so transport,coming or going,does not disturb local residents. Some of the land was reclaimed for old brick pits,by controlled tipping,and the rest was farmed.There are 21 units including 9 small workshop units.Most units are used for light industry e.g. making window frame and processing seafoods.One site was sold to Devon C.C.for the refuse transfer station. Approximatly between 220 _ 300 jobs will be provided.Further work has started to develop 20 acres of adjacient land to provide more units. By Christian.
